content: neck if you want a turtleneck continue ribbing until the neck is approx 4 in bobble with a stretchy bind-off and cut yarn leaving a long enough tail to weave in making the arms rb across the sts held at the bottom of one of the armholes there should be 16 sts here using the same needle pick up 64 sts all around the armhole pm to mark beg of round round 1 k2tog work to 2 sts before you ve worked halfway around the armhole ssk k2tog work to 2 sts before the marker ssk sm round 2 rb around sm repeat rnds 1 and 2 5 more times now we ll halve the number of sts on the needle for each group of 2 sts in the ribbing 2 knits or 2 purls k2tog or p2tog to combine them into one st at the end of this round we ve turned k2p2 ribbing into k1p2 ribbing with half the number of sts continue in k1p1 ribbing until the full arm length is approx 4 5 in repeat for other armhole mirroring increases so that the arms are symmetrical making the bottom hem pick up 76 sts on the bottom of the piece rb in the round until the piece is as long as you like personally i made it around 3 in longer bobble with a stretchy bind off cut yarn leaving a long enough tail to weave in why you might ask is the original body piece not simply knit longer picking up sts on the end of the piece and knitting in the opposite direction creates a bit of a separation creating the illusion of a seam and more dimension for the sweater weave in all ends you re done
